intro: Physurus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf physurus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Physurus latifolius is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
